summary: The Counseling for Career Choice Act amends the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 to expand career counseling opportunities within student support and academic enrichment grants. The bill focuses on providing career guidance, identifying workforce trends, developing resources for school counselors, promoting postsecondary opportunities (apprenticeships, internships, dual enrollment), encouraging partnerships with one-stop centers, leveraging technology (including AI), and evaluating program outcomes. It aims to better prepare students for postsecondary education and career paths.
